result.execSummary:
The defendant David James Maclin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bomb Scares, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.015.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with General Plastics at 2609 W. Mill Rd, Milwaukee, WI.
Attend the following programs and/or assessments: AODA. Maintain absolute sobriety. Undergo random urine screens.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Court waived DNA surcharge because one is already on file. Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered restitution held open until determined at a later date. Restitution hearing scheduled for 7-15-14 @ 8:30 a.m.
**7/15/2014 $12,000.00 payable to General Plastics Inc.  from 25% of all inmate funds.  If revoked as a condition of Extended supervision and/or probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Attend the following programs and/or assessments: Mental Health.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: FORTHWITH. With good time credit. Huber privileges for work. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David James Maclin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: DOC letter regarding mandatory DNA surcharge with notation indicating that the court will not alter the DNA surcharge order in this case.  DOC notified of the same by e-mail.

Defendant David James Maclin in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant David James Maclin in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a stipulation.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $12,000 payable to General Plastics, Inc. from 25% of all inmate funds, if revoked and as a condition of extended supervision and/or probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

Defendant David James Maclin in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant David James Maclin in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  The Court imposed the following sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be 30 MONTHS consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 14 MONTHS with credit for 64 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 16 MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant.  The Court STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH with good time credit. Huber privileges for work.
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA and Mental Health .
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with General Plastics at 2609 W. Mill Rd, Milwaukee, WI.
- Court recommends against electronic monitoring.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Court waived DNA surcharge because one is already on file.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court ordered restitution held open until determined at a later date.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  
- Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 34.  Restitution hearing scheduled for 7-15-2014 at 8:30 am.
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
6/20 now scheduled for plea and sentencing.  kmw

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court, defendant David James Maclin not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant David James Maclin in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant David James Maclin in custody.  Sara N Schroeder for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Bryan Bichler-Glendale Police Department Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with General Plastics located at 2609 W. Mill Rd., Glendale, WI.

Defendant David James Maclin in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant David James Maclin in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
